NewsContent: (CNN) - The leading Muslim civil liberties group in America is calling on Republican Ben Carson to drop out of the 2016 presidential race. The Council on American-Islamic Relations (CAIR) considers statements Carson made over the weekend "anti-Muslim." On Sunday, Carson told NBC's Meet the Press people in the Islamic faith believe their religion should be part of their public life, calling that belief "inconsistent with American principles and the Constitution. "Mr. Ben Carson is wrong today to assume and say that American Muslims cannot be a president of the United States," said Nihad Awad, national executive director of CAIR. "His views are inconsistent with the United States Constitution. For that we really urge politicians, the general public, community leaders, presidential candidates to repudiate his views. And ask Mr. Ben Carson to withdraw from the race because he is unfit to lead because his views are in contradiction with the United States Constitution." Awad went on to clarify the Constitution clearly states there shall be "no religious test" for candidates to seek public office. Carson's business manager said the candidate believes many Americans share his views.
